tweet:
I’m saddened by the passing of my friend and former colleague Thad Cochran. Thad was a true statesmen who loved his home state of Mississippi and his country, and who dedicated his life to serving them both. 

My prayers today are with his family. https://www.clarionledger.com/story/news/politics/2019/05/30/thad-cochran-dies-mississippi-senator-remembered-service/1285123001/ …
This #MemorialDay, as we gather with our family and friends, we remember America’s fallen heroes and pay tribute to the ultimate sacrifice they made for our country. pic.twitter.com/79ggidCdOw

As 5G networks become a reality, it’s critical we get them right. I appreciate @AjitPaiFCC working with Sprint and T-Mobile to make sure rural areas will be widely connected under 5G and that America continues to lead on this next frontier.

This funding will help thousands of NC families still recovering from #HurricaneFlorence. 

It will help rebuild Camp Lejeune & other military bases, providing hundreds of millions of dollars for repairs. 

And it will help make sure we are prepared when the next storm hits. 2/2

After months of stonewalling from Congressional Democrats, I am glad the Senate has finally passed critical disaster relief funding that Americans across the country desperately need. 1/2  https://www.burr.senate.gov/press/releases/senators-burr-tillis-secure-disaster-relief-funding-for-north-carolina …

Robocalls: Everyone gets them, no one likes them. Today, the Senate took a significant step to fight these unwanted, intrusive calls by passing the TRACED Act, which:

✔️Enhances FCC's enforcement against illegal robocallers
✔️Cracks down on caller ID spoofing

Was honored to kick off @nature_org's Land & Water Conservation Fund celebration tonight! Kudos to the many folks there who helped us make #LWCF permanent, so future generations will benefit.
 
But the fight doesn’t end there. Next up: permanent funding. pic.twitter.com/aI3gEPNm2r

Good news: @HUDgov announced NC will receive $336.5 million for Hurricane Florence recovery efforts. This is a step in the right direction, but I remain committed to making sure we prioritize more long-term disaster relief for North Carolinians and our military bases. https://twitter.com/ABC11_WTVD/status/1128345239905812482 …

It was terrific meeting with @NCEmergency yesterday. They’re a great resource to help you and your family create an emergency plan and get important, up-to-date information during a natural disaster. #HurricanePreparednessWeek pic.twitter.com/abdrPQiBJo

This week is #HurricanePreparednessWeek. N.C. has seen some devastating natural disasters in the last few years, including #HurricaneFlorence, so I urge everyone to take hurricane threats seriously and to make an emergency plan now. https://twitter.com/WLOS_13/status/1125423726428938241 …

But the most important thing is making imaging research a reality for patients. Last night’s showcase featured N.C. researchers from @DukeU, @UNC, and @WakeForest (go Deacs!), as well as others from around the country, who are working on just that. 4/4

Nearly 20 years later, NIBIB boasts 230 employees and supports more than 800 active research grants. Because of it, we’re seeing advancements in nanotechnology, leveraging 3-D printing, and exploring the use of AI. Imaging is at the cutting edge of medicine. 3/4

In 2000, @NIH and Congress started the National Institute of Biomedical Imaging & Bioengineering with a clear goal: create a place where biotech, engineering, and research come together to accelerate the future of medical imaging technology.  2/4

It was an honor to speak at @AcadRad’s 10th Anniversary Showcase and see the great work being done by their researchers with support from @NIH’s National Institute of Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering. 
 
Here’s why research agencies like NIBIB are so important. 1/4 pic.twitter.com/gJrV6ygiCJ

STARTING NOW: The Senate Intelligence Committee’s open hearing on the nomination of Dr. Christopher Scolese to serve as Director of the National Reconnaissance Office (NRO).  https://www.intelligence.senate.gov/hearings/open-hearing-nomination-dr-christopher-scolese-be-director-national-reconnaissance-office …
